decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: P0; P1; P2; P3; P4; P5; P6; P7; P8; PLANNING STATEMENT
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Details of the replacement windows hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced (except site clearance, demolition and ground works) and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The details shall include 1:20 cross sectional drawings, materials, transoms, glazing, fixings and ironmongery. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the character and appearance of the dwelling and would preserve the special character and appearance of the St Stephens Conservation Area, in accordance with the Generic Conservation Area Management Plan (2023), policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
description: Alterations to the front garden and boundary wall, including the instillation of a new pedestrian gate and vehicle access gate; refurbishment of the front facade; replacement of windows and doors
